entry.title: Lupe is making tres leches cake this weekend! Here are a few...
entry.content:
Sanctuary4All Colorado is in Boulder, Colorado.

Lupe is making tres leches cake this weekend! Here are a few photos of cakes she’s made in the past. Tres leches cake saves well since it’s so moist—don’t be afraid to order even if you'll be enjoying it solo. It also freezes beautifully. Orders are open at https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co

entry.title: Freedom
entry.content:
Sanctuary4All Colorado

Freedom

Saheeda Nadeem, 65, an undocumented immigrant from Pakistan who was given sanctuary by First Congregational Church in Kalamazoo, Mich., learned this week that she would not be deported, her lawyer said.

nytimes.com

After Three Years in a Church Facing Deportation, ‘Today I Have Freedom’

Saheeda Nadeem, 65, an undocumented immigrant from Pakistan who was given sanctuary by First Congregational Church in Kalamazoo, Mich., learned this week that she would not be deported, her lawyer said.Saheeda Nadeem, 65, an undocumented immigrant from Pakistan who was given sanctuary by First Congregational Church in Kalamazoo, Mich., learned this week that she would not be deported, her lawyer said.

entry.content:
Sanctuary4All Colorado is in Denver, Colorado.

Gaby is selling chicken alfredo and chicken salad this weekend. Please order, share, and support. She’s been raising her children on her own since her husband was deported. You can order at https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co

Gaby is selling chicken salad this weekend along with pollo en salsa alfredo. You can support by ordering at https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co & sharing with friends 💕

entry.title: Last night we drove from Senator Hickenlooper’s office to his...
entry.content:
Sanctuary4All Colorado is in Park Hill, Denver.

Last night we drove from Senator Hickenlooper’s office to his home to protest the vote he took on February 4th to deny undocumented immigrants access to COVID relief. Undocumented immigrants have paid over $118 million into Colorado’s unemployment fund, which they we unable to use, in addition to taxes paid into other social programs that we are barred from accessing. And of course, our taxes have paid Senator Hickenlooper’s salary for years, first when he was mayor of Denver..., then as Governor of Colorado, and now as our senator. We turned out for Senator Hickenlooper, but he hasn’t shown up for us. Which is why it’s so important that, while we keep pushing him, we show up for each other. One way you can do that is through the solidarity meals program. You can order a meal from someone impacted by the U.S. immigration system for pickup on Saturdays. All proceeds go directly to the family cooking. Orders are open now at https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co

See More
